title: newLast month was the wettest May on record--and the second hottest
content: ASHEVILLE, N.C. (WLOS) —   May 2018 was the wettest month in Asheville since record-keeping began in 1851, beating out the previous record holder, August 1940.    On Friday, the National Weather Service (NWS) office in Greenville shared this:      It's official. Asheville breaks the all time monthly record for rainfall. The total of 14.68 inches is nearly an inch more than the previous record of 13.75 set in August of 1940. #avlwx #ncwx      And it wasn't just wet. Also from the NWS on Friday:     It wasn't just wet in Asheville for the month of May. It was also hot. May 2018 was the second hottest May on record. The average temperature of 69.3 missed the record from 1962 by a tenth of a degree      Click here for more weather from News 13.
